page.title: 03Crops At Ascott Home Farm.
page.content: The crops grown in the fields are winter wheat, hay, wheat and rye grass. The same type of crop is grown in a field for 2 to 3 years and the field is then used to grow a different crop. Some of the grass is cut and crimped and made into haylage, which is a cross between silage and hay. It is stored in silos where it ferments and is used for fodder during the winter months when the grass is not growing. Then the cattle are kept in their winter quarters near the milking area. The rest of the grass fields are pasture for the herd of 200 pedigree Friesian cows and bulls. The cows' manure is kept in a slurry pit and is used to fertilize the fields as necessary.
